attributes.action: Reduce the yearly earnings for every MP to £30,000 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Seems a bit stupid that members of parliament can get a salary twice that (if not more) than the average uk salary, as well as claiming expenses in excess of £250,000 each. The time for change is now, let's just hope more than 14 members of parliament turn up to debate this.
attributes.background: MP's have been paid far too much got too long. The average nurse salary in this country is £30,000 and they have lost their right to completely strike courtesy of parliament. Cutting their salary by £54,000 a year will save the country around £35 million a year.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: http://www.theipsa.org.uk
